original: 7 Anusayayamaka🔽7.2 Mahāvāra🔽7.2.3. Pajahanavāra
analyzed: anu saya yamaka  mahāvāra  pa ja ha na vāra
translated: The section on underlying tendencies🔽The long section🔽… The section on giving up

original: 7.2.3.1. Anulomapuggala🔽Yo kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: anuloma puggala  yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: … The forward order of persons🔽Does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to lust give up the underlying tendency to aversion? Yes.

original: Yo vā pana paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: Or does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to aversion give up the underlying tendency to lust? Yes.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ māna anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to lust give up the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He gives up the one that is the root of the other.

original: Yo vā pana mānānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana māna anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Or does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to conceit give up the underlying tendency to lust? No.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to lust give up the underlying tendency to the view of views … the underlying tendency to doubt? No.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to doubt give up the underlying tendency to lust?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He gives up the one that is the root of the other.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to lust give up the underlying tendency to passion for existence … the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He gives up the one that is the root of the other.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Or does anyone who gives up the underlying tendency to ignorance give up the underlying tendency to lust? No.

original: Yo paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ māna anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resistance also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit that is bound up with resistance.

original: Yo vā pana mānānusayaṁ pajahati so paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana māna anusayam pajahati saḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no  yaḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: But does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit also abandon the underlying tendency to resistance? No.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti?🔽Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti  tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resistance also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for form, the underlying tendency to lust for the formless, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to sensual desire, the underlying tendency to ill will, or the underlying tendency to ignorance? No.

original: Yo paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti
translated: But does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance also abandon the underlying tendency to resistance?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.🔽Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati  yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to resistance that is bound up with ignorance.

original: Yo mānānusayaṁ pajahati so diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ māna anusayam pajahati saḥ diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for form, the underlying tendency to lust for the formless, the underlying tendency to resistance, the underlying tendency to sensual desire, the underlying tendency to ill will, or the underlying tendency to ignorance? No.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ māna anusayam pajahati iti
translated: But does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit that is bound up with ignorance.

original: Yo mānānusayaṁ pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ māna anusayam pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit abandon the underlying tendency to lust for becoming … the underlying tendency to ignorance? Yes.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yo diṭṭhānusayaṁ pajahati so vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ māna anusayam pajahati iti āmantā  yaḥ diṭṭha anusayam pajahati saḥ vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance abandon the underlying tendency to conceit? Yes.🔽Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to views abandon the underlying tendency to scepticism? Yes.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so diṭṭhānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ diṭṭha anusayam pajahati iti āmantā pe
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to scepticism abandon the underlying tendency to views? Yes.

original: Yo vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to scepticism abandon the underlying tendency to lust for becoming … the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.🔽Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati  yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no  yaḥ bhava rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ avijjā anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: He abandons that which is of the same root.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance abandon the underlying tendency to scepticism? No.🔽Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust for becoming abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance? Yes.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pajahati iti āmantā ekamūlaka
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance abandon the underlying tendency to lust for becoming? Yes.🔽One root.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati so mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati saḥ māna anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit as a single item.

original: Yo vā pana mānānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana māna anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati iti no
translated: But does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit also abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion? No.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati so diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati saḥ diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion also abandon the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty … the underlying tendency to conceit? No.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: But does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit also abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit as a single item.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for non-sensual becoming … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to sensual desire … the underlying tendency to ill will … the underlying tendency to cruelty?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to cruelty as a single item.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahatīti? No. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati iti no duka mūlaka
translated: But does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to cruelty also abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion? No. (The root of the triad of lust, etc.)

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati so diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati saḥ diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to conceit abandon the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to doubt? None.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to doubt abandon the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to conceit abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence … the underlying tendency to ignorance? None.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance abandon the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Mānānusayaṁ pajahati. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: māna anusayam tika mūlaka
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca pajahati so vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca pajahati saḥ vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views abandon the underlying tendency to doubt? None.

original: Yo vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to views?

original: Diṭṭhānusayaṁ pajahati kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: diṭṭha anusayam pajahati kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca tad ekaṭṭham pajahati pe
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to views, he abandons the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to conceit that are bound up with that . …

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahati so bhavarāgānusayaṁ …pe… avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca pajahati saḥ bhava rāga anusayam pe avijjā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: When anyone abandons the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to ignorance? No.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahatīti?🔽Mānānusayaṁ pajahati. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca pajahati iti 🔽māna anusayam pajahati
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty?🔽When he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, he abandons the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty that are bound up with that . …

original: Yo kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahati so avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yaḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayañca pajahati saḥ avijjā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: Does he who abandons the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for becoming, also abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance? There is none.

original: Yo vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or does he who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance also abandon the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for becoming?

original: Mānānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahati. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: māna anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayam ca pajahati chakkamūlaka
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for becoming. The wheel with six spokes.

original: 7.2.3.2. Anulomaokāsa🔽Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yato vā pana paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati tato mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: anuloma okāsa  yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no  yatas vā pana paṭigha anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no  yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati tatas māna anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: … Regular sequence and reverse sequence🔽From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust? From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to aversion?

original: Yato vā pana mānānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana māna anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti
translated: From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust? From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to aversion?🔽From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust? From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to aversion?🔽From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust? From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to aversion?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato mānānusayaṁ pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato mānānusayañca pajahati kāmarāgānusayañca pajahati.
analyzed: rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tatas māna anusayam pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tatas māna anusayam ca pajahati kāma rāga anusayam ca pajahati
translated: in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust. In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, he abandons both the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti āmantā
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to lust, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to views? … the underlying tendency to conceit? … the underlying tendency to lust?

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to lust, does he also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati, no ca
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati no ca
translated: In painful feeling, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust.

original: tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato vicikicchānusayañca🔽pajahati kāmarāgānusayañca pajahati.🔽Yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.

translated: but he does not abandon the inherent tendency to lust. (The root-causeless.)

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: From the abandoning of the inherent tendency to lust and the inherent tendency to resistance and the inherent tendency to conceit, does he abandon the inherent tendency to false view … the inherent tendency to uncertainty? There is none.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: From the abandoning of the inherent tendency to uncertainty, does he abandon the inherent tendency to lust and the inherent tendency to resistance and the inherent tendency to conceit?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati no ca tatas
translated: In the element of form and in the formless element he abandons the inherent tendency to uncertainty and the inherent tendency to conceit,

original: kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca pajahati kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: but he does not abandon the inherent tendency to lust and the inherent tendency to resistance. In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element he abandons the inherent tendency to uncertainty and the inherent tendency to lust,

original: kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati. Dukkhāya
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati dukkhāya
translated: and he abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment.

original: vedanāya tato vicikicchānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca🔽mānānusayañca pajahati.
analyzed: vedanāya tatas vicikicchā anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca  māna anusayam ca pajahati
translated: In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resentment, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati tatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to desire for being?🔽There is none.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or when he abandons the underlying tendency to desire for being, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Mānānusayaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: māna anusayam
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to conceit.🔽When he abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati tatas avijjā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: There is none.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or when he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato🔽kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca🔽kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati. Dukkhāya
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati no ca tatas  kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca pajahati kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas avijja anusayañca  kāma rāga anusayam ca māna anusayam ca pajahati no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati dukkhāya
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to hate.🔽In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to hate.

original: vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca
analyzed: vedanāya tatas avijja anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca
translated: In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to hate, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: mānānusayañca pajahati. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca pajahati tato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: māna anusayam ca pajahati tikamūlaka  yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca pajahati tatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: (The triad.)🔽From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to hate and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to false view, does the underlying tendency to uncertainty come to be abandoned? There is none.

original: Yato vā pana vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana vicikicchā anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or from the abandoning of the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to hate and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to false view come to be abandoned?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato vicikicchānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca pajahati,
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas vicikicchā anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca pajahati
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca pajahati kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment. In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere

original: tato vicikicchānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca pajahati,
analyzed: tatas vicikicchā anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca pajahati
translated: he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to false view,

original: no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato vicikicchānusayañca paṭighānusayañca
analyzed: no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati dukkhāya vedanāya tatas vicikicchā anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment. In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resentment

original: diṭṭhānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca pajahati …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: diṭṭha anusayañca pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca pajahati pe
translated: and the underlying tendency to false view, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit. … (Fourfold)

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahati tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca pajahati tatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: When he abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to false view and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does he then abandon the underlying tendency to desire for being? There is none.

original: Yato vā pana bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana bhava rāga anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or from the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust for being, does one abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty?

original: Mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahati.
analyzed: māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca pajahati
translated: From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty.

original: Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahati tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca pajahati tatas avijjā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, does one abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance? There is none.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: Or from the abandoning of the underlying tendency to ignorance, does one abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: From the abandoning of the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,

original: pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca pajahati kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: but not from the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment in the sensual dhammas.

original: vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca🔽pajahati, no ca tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati. Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca
analyzed: vedanāsu tatas avijjā anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca  pajahati no ca tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayam ca
translated: Then, in regard to painful feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt🔽are abandoned, but the underlying tendency to aversion is not abandoned. In regard to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance and🔽

original: paṭighānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca🔽mānānusayañca pajahati. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahati tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Natthi.
analyzed: paṭigha anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca  māna anusayam ca pajahati pañcaka mūlaka  yatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayañca pajahati tatas avijjā anusayam pajahati iti natthi
translated: Then he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment. In painful feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit. In neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment. (Fivefold)🔽From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to ignorance? There is none.

original: Yato vā pana avijjānusayaṁ pajahati tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahatīti?
analyzed: yatas vā pana avijjā anusayam pajahati tatas kāma rāga anusayam ca paṭigha anusayam ca māna anusayam ca diṭṭha anusayam ca vicikicchā anusayam ca bhava rāga anusayam ca pajahati iti
translated: From the abandoning of which underlying tendencies is there the abandoning of the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tato avijjānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tatas avijjā anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty,

original: bhavarāgānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca paṭighānusayañca pajahati.
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayañca pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca pajahati
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to resistance.

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tato avijjānusayañca kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca
analyzed: kāmadhātuyāḥ dvīsu vedanāsu tatas avijja anusayañca kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for existence, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty,

original: vicikicchānusayañca pajahati, no ca tato paṭighānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahati.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayañca pajahati no ca tatas paṭigha anusayañca bhava rāga anusayañca pajahati
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires.

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya tato avijjānusayañca paṭighānusayañca diṭṭhānusayañca vicikicchānusayañca
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tatas avijjā anusayañca paṭigha anusayañca diṭṭha anusayañca vicikicchā anusayañca
translated: In painful feeling, he abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to resistance, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty,🔽but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the direct order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the reverse order.

original: pajahati, no ca tato kāmarāgānusayañca mānānusayañca bhavarāgānusayañca pajahati. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: pajahati no ca tatas kāma rāga anusayañca māna anusayañca bhava rāga anusayañca pajahati chakkamūlaka
translated: … With regard to persons and ideas in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the direct order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the reverse order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons in the direct order.🔽… With regard to persons in the reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the direct order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the direct and reverse order.

original: 7.2.3.3. Anulomapuggalokāsa
analyzed: anuloma puggala ukāsa
translated: … With regard to persons in the direct order.🔽… With regard to persons in the reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the direct order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the reverse order.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: … With regard to ideas in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the direct order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons and ideas in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons in the direct order.🔽… With regard to persons in the reverse order.🔽… With regard to persons in the direct and reverse order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the direct order.🔽… With regard to ideas in the reverse order.🔽…

original: Yo vā pana yato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resistance also abandon the underlying tendency to lust? No.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas māna anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust also abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: He abandons the latter together with the former.

original: Yo vā pana yato mānānusayaṁ pajahati so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas māna anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit also abandon the underlying tendency to lust? No.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust also abandon the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty? No.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty also abandon the underlying tendency to lust?

original: Aṭṭhamako dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati,
analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati
translated: An eighth-promoter in painful feeling, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty there,

original: no ca so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati. Sveva puggalo kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: no ca saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati su eva puggalaḥ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust there. That same person in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere

original: so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati kāmarāgānusayaṁ tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati kāma rāga anusayam tad ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty there and the underlying tendency to lust there together with the former.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati iti no  yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the fetter of lust for sensual pleasure also abandon the fetter of lust for existence? No.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the fetter of lust for existence also abandon the fetter of lust for sensual pleasure? No.

original: Yo yato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the fetter of lust for sensual pleasure also abandon the fetter of ignorance?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.🔽Yo vā pana yato avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so tato kāmarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati  yaḥ vā pana yatas avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas kāma rāga anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: He abandons it when it is of the same kind.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the fetter of ignorance also abandon the fetter of lust for sensual pleasure? No.

original: Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so tato mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo vā pana yato mānānusayaṁ pajahati so tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas māna anusayam pajahati iti no  yaḥ vā pana yatas māna anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the fetter of resentment also abandon the fetter of conceit? No.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the fetter of conceit also abandon the fetter of resentment? No.

original: Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the fetter of resentment also abandon the fetter of views … the fetter of uncertainty? No.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the fetter of uncertainty also abandon the fetter of resentment?

original: Aṭṭhamako kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ
analyzed: aṭṭhamako kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tatas vicikicchā anusaya
translated: One on the eighth path of arahantship abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty about the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material and immaterial spheres,🔽but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to resentment about them.

original: pajahati, no ca so tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati. Sveva puggalo dukkhāya vedanāya
analyzed: pajahati no ca so tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati su eva puggalaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: The same person, when he is experiencing painful feeling,

original: so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati paṭighānusayaṁ tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.🔽Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: saḥ tatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati paṭigha anusayam tad ekaṭṭham pajahati  yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati iti no  yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty about that feeling and abandons the underlying tendency to resentment that is bound to that.🔽Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resentment about any kind of feeling also abandon the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires? No.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires about any kind of feeling also abandon the underlying tendency to resentment about that kind of feeling? No.

original: Yo yato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahati so tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to resentment about any kind of feeling also abandon the underlying tendency to ignorance about that kind of feeling?

original: Tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.🔽Yo vā pana yato avijjānusayaṁ pajahati so tato paṭighānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: tat ekaṭṭham pajahati  yaḥ vā pana yatas avijjā anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas paṭigha anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: He abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance that is bound to that.🔽Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to ignorance about any kind of feeling also abandon the underlying tendency to resentment about that kind of feeling? No.

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ pajahati so tato diṭṭhānusayaṁ …pe… vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ yatas māna anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas diṭṭha anusayam pe vicikicchā anusayam pajahati iti no
translated: Does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to conceit about any kind of feeling also abandon the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty about that kind of feeling? No.

original: Yo vā pana yato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati so tato mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas māna anusayam pajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty abandon the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: Aṭṭhamako dukkhāya vedanāya so tato vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati, no ca so tato mānānusayaṁ🔽pajahati. Sveva puggalo kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā so tato
analyzed: aṭṭhamako dukkhāya vedanāya so tatas vicikicchā anusayam pajahati no ca so tatas māna anusaya  pajahati su eva puggalaḥ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā saḥ tatas
translated: The eighth person abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty in painful feeling, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to conceit there.

original: vicikicchānusayaṁ pajahati mānānusayaṁ tadekaṭṭhaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayam pajahati māna anusayam tad ekaṭṭham pajahati
translated: That same person abandons the underlying tendency to uncertainty in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of feeling, and he abandons the underlying tendency to conceit that is bound up with that.

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ pajahati so tato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ yatas māna anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati iti

analyzed: agga magga samaṅgī kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu saḥ tatas māna anusayam pajahati no ca so  tatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati su eva puggalaḥ rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā saḥ tatas māna anusayam ca
translated: One who possesses the path of no more learning abandons the underlying tendency to conceit in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, but he does not abandon the underlying tendency to lust for existence there.

analyzed: pajahati bhava rāga anusayam ca pajahati

original: Yo vā pana yato bhavarāgānusayaṁ pajahati so tato mānānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana yatas bhava rāga anusayam pajahati saḥ tatas māna anusayam pajahati iti āmantā

original: Yo yato mānānusayaṁ pajahati so tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahatīti? Āmantā.

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya so tato avijjānusayaṁ pajahati, no ca so tato🔽mānānusayaṁ pajahati. Sveva puggalo kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
analyzed: agga magga samaṅgī dukkhāya vedanāya saḥ tatas avijjā anusayam pajahati no ca so tatas  māna anusayam pajahati su eva puggalaḥ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
